title: How to Make a Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker

steps.headline: Break 2 eggs in a bowl and beat it well.
Add 1 tsp of vanilla essence and 1/2 a cup of oil and beat it well.
Add flour little by little and beat it until the batter becomes smooth.
Add 1/2 tsp of baking powder and 1/2 a cup of sugar.
steps.description: Mix it well and beat it until it becomes smooth.

steps.headline: Add 4 tsps of cocoa powder and mix until it looks like a liquid chocolate.
Take a tin suitable for the pressure cooker and grease it with oil.
Add flour little by little above the oil in the tin.
Pour the batter into the tin.
Preheat for 5 minutes on high temperature.
Place the cake mixture into the pressure cooker.
steps.description: Leave on a low heat for approximately 25-30 minutes.

steps.headline: After 25 minutes, open the pressure cooker and put a knife in the center of the cake.
steps.description: If it the cake mixture sticks to the knife, place the cake back into the pressure cooker for an extra 5-10 minutes. If there is no mixture on your knife, your cake is cooked.

steps.headline: Remove the cake from the tin.

text: Break 2 eggs in a bowl and beat it well.  Add 1 tsp of vanilla essence and 1/2 a cup of oil and beat it well.  Add flour little by little and beat it until the batter becomes smooth.  Add 1/2 tsp of baking powder and 1/2 a cup of sugar. Mix it well and beat it until it becomes smooth. Add 4 tsps of cocoa powder and mix until it looks like a liquid chocolate.  Take a tin suitable for the pressure cooker and grease it with oil.  Add flour little by little above the oil in the tin.  Pour the batter into the tin.  Preheat for 5 minutes on high temperature.  Place the cake mixture into the pressure cooker. Leave on a low heat for approximately 25-30 minutes. After 25 minutes, open the pressure cooker and put a knife in the center of the cake. If it the cake mixture sticks to the knife, place the cake back into the pressure cooker for an extra 5-10 minutes. If there is no mixture on your knife, your cake is cooked. Remove the cake from the tin.  Plate up, and serve.
